Body:
Description: Hi Team,

Legal team just approved the provision of a root account for customer Naukri. Please schedule a remote session to implement the necessary actions to finalize this process and provide Naukri team with the requested credentials.

Thank you,

Oana Nemes | Team Lead, Customer Success
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com  
(+40) 264-593 110

Based on the request coming from Oana I have created an account with which the customer can connect SSH to the EPP server backend.

"eppsupport" account was created - with limited rights (not sudo)
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Alin Anca, Vaneet Kumar

What We've Learned Updated: - added the "eppsupport" account  with limited rights (not sudo)
- customer reopened the ticket because those permisions are not enough for the operations that they want to perform (clearing file shadows)
Next Steps Updated: - connect with the customer and assign the desired permisions to the backend account

What We've Learned Updated: - added the "eppsupport" account  with limited rights (not sudo)
- customer reopened the ticket because those permisions are not enough for the operations that they want to perform (clearing file shadows)
- connected again to add sudo right
